channel.title: Discrete Random Variables on Amit Rajan
channel.description: Recent content in Discrete Random Variables on Amit Rajan

item.title: Random Variables (Part 1: Discrete Random Variables)
item.description: Random Variable is a variable whose possible values are numerical outcomes of a random phenomenon or experiment. In other words, a random variable assigns a numeric value to each outcome of a random experiment. For example, if we roll a fair die, the random variable $X$ describing the experiment will take the values $1,2,3,4,5,6$ (which are the possible outcomes of the experiment). There are two types of random variables: discrete and continuous.
